page.title: 12Farming in East Huntspill
page.content: The farm is 300 years old and covers 5 acres on which 60 friesian cows and sheep are raised.In the summer the cows eat grass and in the winter they eat cow cake.The food for the animals comes from feed merchants.In the morning the farmers get up at 6.30am and in the summer they finish at 9.00pm. In the winter they finish at 8.00pm. The farm produces milk,eggs, pigs,sheep,and jam.They have got a camping area and a shop for campers. It opens from 10.00am till 6.00pm. This year the owners have opened a farm trail through their property so that the public can see some interesting farming exhibits from the past,as well as a range of animals.
